title: 112_s2225
content: Rural Energy for America Program. Section 9007 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include a nonprofit organization in subsection (b)(2) and establish a loan guarantee and grant program for agricultural producers and rural small businesses to purchase renewable energy systems in subsection (c). The amended Section 9007 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 now includes a loan guarantee and grant program for agricultural producers and rural small businesses to purchase renewable energy systems, including systems for electricity production and energy efficiency improvements. The program uses a 3-tiered application process based on project sizes. The Secretary will establish separate application processes for projects based on their cost under the subsection. Tier 1 is for projects under $80,000, Tier 2 for projects between $80,000 and $200,000, and Tier 3 for projects equal to or exceeding $200,000. The Secretary will establish an application, evaluation, and oversight process for projects funded under this subsection, with a simplified process for tier I projects and a more comprehensive process for subsequent tiers. Additionally, the natural resource conservation benefits of the renewable energy system will be considered. In subsection (f), the Secretary will establish an application process for projects funded under this section, with simplified procedures for tier I projects and more comprehensive ones for subsequent tiers. The renewable energy system's natural resource conservation benefits will also be taken into account. Amendments include adjusting grant amounts and removing certain requirements. The Secretary will submit a report to Congress on activities and outcomes of projects funded under this section within 4 years of enactment. Amendments in subsection (g) include adjusting grant amounts for fiscal years 2012 through 2017 and specifying funding allocation. The Secretary will submit a report to Congress on activities and outcomes of projects funded under this section within 4 years of enactment. Funding allocation for fiscal years 2013 through 2017 is set at $100,000,000 each year.
